Package model

Interface Player

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    PlayerImpl
    public interface Player
    Represents a single player in the GameEngine in Further Programming Assignment.

    Is to be implemented as PlayerImpl.

    Each player has a unique id (the unique id is enforced elsewhere) and a name, both of which cannot be changed once assigned. The player has a points balance which is used in placing bets within the game. Bet and Hand objects also represent information relevant to the game.

    Author:
    Ross Nye
    See Also:
    GameEngine, Bet, Hand

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        java.lang.String getId()

      • getName

      • getPoints

        int getPoints()
        Simple getter for player's current points (excluding any amount currently bet)
        Returns:
        the player's current points

      • getTotalPoints

        int getTotalPoints()
        Returns the current total points for a player, which includes any amount currently bet.

        Hint: If the player doesn't have a current bet this method should return the current points, otherwise add the bet's value to it.

        Returns:
        the player's current total points.

      • assignBet

        void assignBet​(Bet bet)
        Assigns the supplied bet placed for the player via the GameEngine.

        The players points should be adjusted accordingly and the supplied bet parameter assigned to an appropriate instance variable.

        Take care when replacing a bet as the original bet amount has already been deducted from the current points.

        Hint: Try to ensure you don't duplicate code between the Game Engine, Bet and Player when dealing with bets.

        Parameters:
        bet - a valid Bet object

      • getBet

        Bet getBet()
        Simple getter method for the currently assigned Bet
        Returns:
        the Bet object

      • getHand

        Hand getHand()
        Simple getter method to return the player's Hand
        Returns:
        the player's Hand

      • applyBetResult

        void applyBetResult​(Hand houseHand)
        Applies the result the player's bet based on the supplied house hand.

        This methods should finalise the bet and apply the win, loss or draw to the player's points balance.

        If the supplied houseHand is null this method should do nothing (and exit gracefully).

        Note: When applying the result ensure you take into account the points that were quarantined in the bet amount.

        Parameters:
        houseHand - the Hand that was dealt to the House

      • resetBet

        void resetBet()
        Sets the appropriate instance variable to Bet.NO_BET

        It may be necessary to refund a bet and existing bet if is has not been finalised.

      • toString

        java.lang.String toString()
        Override Object.toString(). Generates a string representing the player as seen in the output trace. The following are examples of such strings.
        • Player id=P1, name=Player One, points=800, No Bet, Empty Hand
        • Player id=P1, name=Player One, points=800, Score Bet for 100, Hand of 3 cards [6 of Spades, 7 of Clubs, 5 of Clubs] Score: 18
        • Player id=P2, name=Player Two, points=1800, Suit Bet for 100 on Clubs, Hand of 2 cards [Jack of Hearts, 7 of Clubs] Score: 17
        Note: This method uses toString() methods from other classes to produce part of these results.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representing the player as seen in the output trace
